main event: An unidentified object, described as an irregularly-shaped, 7'x3' white plastic balloon, was found trailing against a tree in Temple, Oklahoma on 10 October 1958.
interesting points: The object was found with a note attached in Russian that read 'I do not understand Russian - How are you?'. Investigators concluded it was likely a grounded weather balloon. The note was identified as a prank. The balloon was described to be similar in size to an ordinary weather balloon. Various reports classified the object as an ordinary plastic balloon with no unusual characteristics.
witness description: The sighting involved civilian witnesses, reliability unknown, aged approximately 25-37.
